Uses of Interface
javaslang.Function2

  • Packages that use Function2 
    Package Description
    javaslang
    The javaslang package contains core types like λ, Tuple and ValueObject.
    javaslang.algebra
    Algebraic interfaces used to describe inherent class properties like Monad1.
    javaslang.collection
    Immutable collections based on Traversable like the linked list List and the lazy linked list Stream.

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      default T Traversable.fold(T zero, Function2<? super T,? super T,? extends T> op)
      Accumulates the elements of this Traversable by successively calling the given operator op.
      default <U> U Traversable.foldLeft(U zero, Function2<? super U,? super T,? extends U> f)
      Accumulates the elements of this Traversable by successively calling the given function f from the left, starting with a value zero of type B.
      default <U> U Traversable.foldRight(U zero, Function2<? super T,? super U,? extends U> f)
      Accumulates the elements of this Traversable by successively calling the given function f from the right, starting with a value zero of type B.
      default T Traversable.reduce(Function2<? super T,? super T,? extends T> op)
      Accumulates the elements of this Traversable by successively calling the given operation op.
      default T Traversable.reduceLeft(Function2<? super T,? super T,? extends T> op)
      Accumulates the elements of this Traversable by successively calling the given operation op from the left.
      default T Traversable.reduceRight(Function2<? super T,? super T,? extends T> op)
      Accumulates the elements of this Traversable by successively calling the given operation op from the right.
